snippet: Widely seen video of ugly incidents has obscured daily examples of kindness during an overwhelming rush across the border, officials say.
abstract: Hungarian authorities continue to battle video images giving impression of xenophobic and sometimes violent responses to hundreds of thousands of migrants flooding into country; while some say harsh images are unfair representation of reaction of Hungarians to refugees, argument is undermined by fact that government itself has publicized a hard-line response to migrant crisis and is leading voice against European Union's plan to distribute 160,000 migrants across member nations.

byline.original: By PALKO KARASZ and HELENE BIENVENU
byline.contributor: Palko Karasz reported from Budapest, and Helene Bienvenu from Szeged, Hungary. Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Widely seen video of ugly incidents has obscured daily examples of kindness during an overwhelming rush across the border, officials say.

headline.main: Hungarians Say Images of Harshness Toward Migrants Are Unfair
headline.print_headline: Perception of Harshness Toward Needy Refugees Is Unfair, Hungary Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
